107530.name: The Fairy's Hart
107530.description:
From the Game Chef website:

A supernatural romance for two. Oberon’s daughter has fallen in love with a mortal man seen in the forest and must win his love without using her magics.

Game Chef 2011 runner up.

107531.name: As I Am Woman
107531.description:
From the Game Chef website:

A Shakespearean woman takes gender subversion to extremes. Play out the repercussions across five acts!

Game Chef 2011 runner up.

107532.description:
BEES

In BEES players try to collect nectar and pollen from flowers and bring it to their colonies to create the most prosperous.

The purpose of BEES is to get as many points in a certain number of rounds corresponding to the number of players. You must place the bees on the flowers to modify its initial value and gain control and collect points. Points are obtained only from flowers whose value corresponds with the hidden objective of the player. After finishing all rounds, the player who accumulates the most points wins.

The game components are:
8 flowers (2 red, 2 green, 2 blue and 2 orange) with values ​​printed on them (5, 4, 3 and 2)
16 Bees (4 red, 4 green, 4 blue and 4 orange)


=====

ABEJAS

En ABEJAS los jugadores tratan de recolectar el néctar y el polen de las flores y llevarlo a sus respectivas colonias para crear la más próspera.

El objetivo de ABEJAS es obtener el mayor número de puntos en un número de rondas determinado, correspondiente al número de jugadores. Debes colocar las abejas sobre las flores para modificar su valor inicial y lograr controlarlas y acumular puntos. Solo se obtienen puntos de las flores cuyo valor corresponde con el del objetivo oculto del jugador. Tras finalizar todas las rondas, el jugador que haya acumulado más puntos es el ganador.

Los componentes del juego son:
8 flores (2 rojas, 2 verdes, 2 azules y 2 naranjas) con valores impresos sobre ellas (5, 4, 3 y 2)
16 abejas (4 rojas, 4 verdes, 4 azules y 4 naranjas)
107532.name: Abejas

boardgamehonor: 2011 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee
107533.name: Siebenpunkt
107533.description:
In this tactical tile-laying game, the players try to create living space for as many animals as possible. At the same time, they want to fulfill requests for ecological compensation areas – and it will be even better if these areas can be used for traditional farming.

In Siebenpunkt, you need to balance both space for animals and ecological compensation areas in order to strengthen biodiversity and win the game.

107534.description:
Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack A is one of two expansion packs for Michael Schacht's Mondo released in late 2011. Each pack includes a double-sided game board that allows an additional player to be added to the game. The pack also includes new land tiles (identical in sets A and B), new scoring methods and new challenges to complete (both unique to pack A).

By combining packs A and B, up to six players can compete in Mondo – and theoretically the number of players is unlimited if you add an equally unlimited number of packs.

Integrates with:

Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack B
107534.name: Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack A

107535.description:
Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack B is one of two expansion packs for Michael Schacht's Mondo released in late 2011. Each pack includes a double-sided game board that allows an additional player to be added to the game. The pack also includes new land tiles (identical in sets A and B), new scoring methods and new challenges to complete (both unique to pack B).

By combining packs A and B, up to six players can compete in Mondo – and theoretically the number of players is unlimited if you add an equally unlimited number of packs.

Integrates with:

Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack A
107535.name: Mondo: Zusatzspieler Pack B

107536.name: Order & Chaos Online
107536.description:
User Summary

A 3D MMORPG for iOS and Android devices, best described as World of Warcraft lite. Order and Chaos features a standard class and quest based system frequently found in standard MMOs. Players get to pick their race, class and character appearance. As with most MMOs, stats are set by class and equipment. However, players are able to customize their class skills via allotting points in their class' skill tree.

The game is subscription based though players receive 3 months of free play. Order and Chaos also has an in-game cash item shop.

107537.name: Polemos S.P.Q.R
107537.description:
Polemos SPQR rules are designed for those who wish to recreate the epic battles of the period of dominance of the Roman Legionary. You are placed firmly in the position of the General. Can you repeat the famous exploits of Caesar or Arminius: Now is your chance!

The booklet contains detailed listings and descriptions of eleven armies from Britain to Parthia featuring a unique army generation system as well as historical information and background.

107538.name: Bonded Realities
107538.description:
User Summary

You are dropped off a daycare by your mother but are quickly transported to another world along with your three friends. You must find all of your friends and defeat the final boss. The game is a turn based RPG, level up and find or buy better equipment.

107539.name: Mystic Quests: Core Rulebook
107539.description:
from the Mystic Quests website

Three thousand years in the future humans descended on the planet Sarax. Over the next fifty years they created technologically advanced cities that were not just cities but beautiful works of art in themselves. Then the creatures came; Goblins, Orcs, Elves and things far worse. Now after untold horrors, disasters, sacrifices and isolation humanity has reverted back to a medieval state desperately fighting to stay alive...

Play as adventurers questing to save the world of Sarax from destruction. This game requires one or more players also unlike many other role playing games it requires no gamesmaster or minatures.

designer comment
The Mystic Quests Core Rulebook contains everything you need to start playing Mystic Quests, including the adventurer sheet and puzzle grids.

107540.name: Soulcaster
107540.description:
User Summary

You've awoken the undead and most find and summon warriors to fight them off. The game is a top down game with NES like graphics. Summon different warriors with Y,X,A,B to fight for you. Summoned characters have different stats and abilities, some attack at ranged, some are good for defense, and some can attack over walls. Find money to upgrade your characters and scrolls to damage monsters.

The game is available for 240 MS Points on the XBLA Indie Marketplace.

107541.name: Grabräuber am Mhanadi
107541.description:
from the back of the book

Ancient amgic kingdoms ruled the land of Tulamids for centuries and millennia. Today, only a touch of old grandeur remains, but under the muddy banks of major rivers and in the barren steppes of the plateau relics of this bygone era still can be found. Forgotten grave-pyramids, hidden temples of foreign gods and deep catacombs are awaiting their discovery.

Der Fluch des Sultans (The Curse of the Sultan) is to be broken in the first adventure. For this, the heroes must penetrate a half-buried palace (by a dschinni) to fight against the demonic corpse of the old Sultan.

Begraben unter Staub (Buried under dust) lies an ancient temple from the last days of tulamidic splendor in Fasar. Strange gods were worshiped here, and a coven of cultists has a sinister plan to awaken the servants of a ruler of the forgotten town.

Starting in Khunchom, the heroes must find Die Maske des Heiligen (The mask of the saint). On behalf of a priest of Peraine the grave of a mysterious magician must be found and his suitability as a saint accessed.

For over a thousand years, Das Vermächtnis der Kophtanim (the legacy of the of the Kophtanim) was guarded near the Ongalo river, but recent events have awakened an ancient artifact that is looking after its master - and thereby brings fear and terror in a small village.

107542.name: Soulcaster II
107542.description:
User Summary

The game is a top down game with NES like graphics. Summon different warriors with Y,X,A,B to fight for you. Summoned characters have different stats and abilities, some attack at ranged, some are good for defense, and some can attack over walls. Find money to upgrade your characters and scrolls to damage monsters.

Updates to the first game include making the game more difficult, improving the graphics, giving details on how much upgrades improve characters, and better music.

The game is available for 240 MS Points on the XBLA Indie Marketplace.

107543.name: Watchmen: The End is Nigh Part 1
107543.description:
User Summary

This third-person beat 'em up takes place 10 years before the events depicted in the classic comic, WATCHMEN. The game chronicles the early adventures of Night Owl and Rorschach while they were a crime-fighting duo. The gameplay differs slightly between the two characters. Rorschach is better at brawling crowd control, whereas Night Owl uses more finesse and is better at fighting enemies one at a time. Both characters have brutal finishing moves that can be used to put down enemies.

Part 1 consists of 6 chapters (the final chapter is a boss battle with The Underboss). It can be played single-player or local co-op for two players (there is no online play).

107544.name: Watchmen: The End is Nigh Part 2
107544.description:
User Summary

This third-person beat 'em up takes place 10 years before the events depicted in the classic comic, WATCHMEN. The game chronicles the early adventures of Night Owl and Rorschach while they were a crime-fighting duo. The gameplay differs slightly between the two characters. Rorschach is better at brawling crowd control, whereas Night Owl uses more finesse and is better at fighting enemies one at a time. Both characters have brutal finishing moves that can be used to put down enemies.

Part 2 consists of 3 chapters (the final chapter is a boss battle with the Twilight Lady). The choice you make during the final confrontation will determine the end of the game. It can be played single-player or local co-op for two players (there is no online play).

107545.name: Doom and Destiny
107545.description:
Doom & Destiny is an old-school RPG with tons of attitude, content and comedy!

Help Nigel, Mike, Johnny and Francis, four nerdy friends, to fight their way through the funniest quest they ever had!

Trapped in a fantasy world and mistaken for Heroes, those four nerds will have to deal with long journeys, hundreds of enemies, villains, super villains and even an Unnamed super villain!

Will they be destined to become real Heroes?
Will they manage to return home?
Will they manage to find a good Pizza restaurant in this weird fantasy world?

More than 25 hours of gameplay, huge party customization, over 500 items, between potions, weapons, armour and accessories, over 200 special Powers and attacks to defeat over 300 enemies, an immersive and rich world, with tons of locations, cities, dungeons, secrets and challenges.

Doom & Destiny is a must for every old-school rpg lover and video game fan!

Source: The Developer Website.

107546.name: NCAA Basketball 09: March Madness Edition
107546.description:
User Summary

This downloadable game from EA was an experiment. It is the same game engine as their NCAA Basketball 09 game, but you are only able to select from the 64 teams that made it to the tournament that year. The game should feel familiar to anyone who has played this series. Each team has three different tempos from which to select: up tempo, balanced, half-court. Each team also selects three coaching goals to focus on during the game. Adhering to both of these sets of criteria will generally improve the chance of winning. There is also a spectator mode that will play out match-ups to show the gamer who would likely win. All of the teams' stats are tweaked to reflect the current standings at the time of release.

This game allows for 1-4 players on local console only. (There is no online multi-player.)

107547.name: Guarding
107547.description:
User Summary

Violence: 2
Sex: 0
Mature Content: 2

Control a party of three characters in this RPG. Start with a group of five characters who have all been raised and trained by the retired leader of the royal guards.

The game is available for 80 MS Points on the XBL Indie Marketplace.

107548.name: Lumi
107548.description:
User Summary

Travel through a beautiful world that has started to be overtaken by darkness. Attempt to save it by finding fragments to push back the darkness. As Lumi you have control of light magnetic powers and are able to traverse the world by holding either the L or R button to pull yourself to blue or red light.

The game is available for 240 MS Points on the XBL Indie Marketplace.

107549.name: Крокодил
107549.description:
This game is a tabletop version of "Crocodile", a very famous Russian party game. In Crocodile, players have to explain words using only movements and gestures. The game includes a number of additional rules and tasks that add twists to the basic game of Crocodile and make it even more fun to play.

The gameplay is simple. Players are divided into teams, and then each team will take turns: one player has one minute to explain as many words as possible while the other team members try to guess them quickly to gain more points. Words will be worth more or less points depending on their difficulty, as they could be anything from ordinary objects to entire phrases.

In addition, the team can use special cards that can change the entire course of the game. These "U-cards" can be played before the player begins explaining words, and include abilities such as:
- "First letter": You are allowed to say the first letter of the word;
- "Additional minute": You are given one additional minute to explain;
- "Replace a player": You can change the player who is going to explain the words - this lets competing teams gain an advantage by preventing good players from participating.
- "With closed eyes" - Have you ever tried to explain something without seeing others?
- "Robbery": You can guess the word of another team and steal their points

The game contains 200 cards with words. Each card has 10 tasks, so the game comes with 2,000 words and phrases.

107551.description:
From publisher:

"Chaos Chess. A revolution on the back-and-white field" is a variation of the classic game of chess. The goal of the game remains the same – checkmate your opponent. However, your arsenal is no longer limited by the 16 pieces on the board!

During the course of the game, you can use special cards: mutations, intrigues and maneuvers. Each card introduces a temporary or permanent change into the normal rules of chess. The game strategy becomes much more diversified as it becomes impossible to foretell your opponent’s tactic. An element of chance is added to the game (something completely absent from the classic game of chess). The tables can turn at any time, imposing drastic changes on either side. This is why players in extremely dire situations still have a legitimate chance to win.

In addition to this game set, you will need a chess board with the standard pieces for both sides. You will also at least need to be able to play chess at the most rudimentary level.

"Chess of chaos" is a card addition to classic chess, the idea was created on the base of the game "Tempête sur l'échiquier". "Chess of chaos" is produced in Russia with the permission of the original authors.
107551.name: Шахматы Хаоса

107552.name: CrimeCraft
107552.description:
CrimeCraft revolves around gang warfare, combining role-playing elements as well as an MMO environment. A large, persistent city acts as the game’s lobby where players can form gangs, accept missions and buy new weapons. The game consists of seven game modes, which can be broken down into two major categories: PvP game modes, wherein players compete against each other, and PvE game modes, wherein players compete against computer controlled AI bots. Other features include questing, achievements, crafting and gang hideouts.

Source: Wikipedia, "CrimeCraft", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107553.name: CrimeCraft: Bleedout
107553.description:
BLEEDOUT is the first major, episodic content expansion to the MMO Role-Playing Shooter CrimeCraft.

The BLEEDOUT Campaign takes place across 10 episodes, each featuring 2 1/2 hours of new story based missions. Featuring art from comic book allstars (Tim Bradstreet, Ben Templesmith, Nathan Fox and more).

Source: The Developer Website.

107554.name: Space Pirates and Zombies
107554.description:
Space Pirates and Zombies takes place far enough in the future that Earth has become a toxic backwater planet, so potentially not that far in the future. The galaxy has been colonized by humans, and the only means to travel to new star systems is through highly restricted and well defended warp gates. It is well known that systems closer to the galactic core become richer and richer as well as more scientifically advanced. This has led to theories of a secret system with a cache of treasure or knowledge at the galactic core feeding this growth. As a pirate, you must assemble a fleet and discover what treasure awaits you there.

Source: The Game Website.

107555.name: Spy for George Washington
107555.description:
From the back cover:

You are a spy for the Colonists in the Revolutionary War. You've been entrusted with a special task: obtain the British plans and bring them back to General George Washington! But enemy patrols are everywhere. How can you get back through the British lines without suspicion?

107556.name: The Magic of the Unicorn
107556.description:
From the back cover:

You Must Seek The Realm Of The Unicorn

Only a unicorn's horn can purify the water in your medieval village - so you set off to find a unicorn. After a long search you meet a sorceress who promises to help you. She offers you a choice of two spells. Once will give you the power to speak with animals. The other will weave you a golden net for catching magical beasts. Which spell should you choose?

107557.name: ARMA X: Anniversary Edition
107557.description:
Arma X: Anniversary Edition brings a unique collection of all Armaversum titles released to date, exclusively wrapped together in one package. Built on over 10 years experience, Arma X thrusts you into the heart of the most realistic military simulator ever developed, featuring cutting edge technology, vast, detailed environments defined by real geographic data and authentically modeled units and vehicles. Play all of the story-driven campaigns sequentially for the ultimate military combat experience!

Source: The Publisher Website.

107558.name: The Mardi Gras Mystery
107558.description:
From the back cover:

Trapped in the House of Blood!

You're in New Orleans, spending the Mardi Gras holiday with your uncle. One night he takes you to a masked ball at the mysterious Maison du Sang, the House of Blood. You've just stepped inside the ballroom when a sinister-looking servant approaches your uncle. "The hostess wishes to see you alone," he says. Now you're left in the ballroom without him. What do you do?

107559.name: Hamilton's Great Adventure
107559.description:
Hamilton’s Great Adventure is a co-op puzzle adventure of epic grandeur and magnificence.

Take part in an amazing journey, guiding the splendiferous adventurer Ernest Hamilton and his brilliant bird Sasha as they co-operate to crack crafty conundrums and challenges!

Progress through four unique and visually stunning environments. Delve into gameplay featuring both action puzzling and traditional problem solving. Immerse yourself into a fantastical storyline filled with extravagant escapades and memorable characters.

Source: The Publisher Website.

107560.name: Mystery of the Secret Room
107560.description:
From the back cover:

When your great-aunt Celia decides to take off on an expedition, she leaves you in charge of her strange, old house. It looks as though she won't return by the end of the month, so you follow the instructions in her note. You open the door to a secret room where you find three boxes - and another note from your aunt. "Open one - but only one - of the boxes!" it says. Which box will you choose?

107561.name: Sugarcane Island
107561.description:
From the back cover:

You're Trapped In A Deadly Paradise!

You're on a ship headed for an expedition on the Galapagos Islands. Suddenly a tidal wave sweeps you off the deck and onto the beach of a strange tropical island. You're searching for help when you fall into a deep animal pit. At last some islanders haul you out. "Is this friend?" asks one. "No," the other one snarls. "This is enemy!"

107562.name: The Trumpet of Terror
107562.description:
From the back cover:

You Are The Only Mortal Who Can Save The Gods!

You live in the age when might Norse gods rule the earth. Their one-eyed leader, Odin, has come to beg you for help. He says you are the only human clever enough to free the gods from the spell of the evil and greedy witch who is tormenting them. To succeed in this awesome task, you know that you'll need help - but whom should you ask?

107563.name: ArmA: Cold War Assault
107563.description:
The horrors of WWIII are imminent. There are clashes over the Malden Islands from dusk to dawn and you are caught in-between. You must use all of the available resources in your arsenal to hold back the incoming darkness. Victor Troska came back to Nogovo, he thought the pain of war was left buried in his past. But his dream lies broken now. His worst nightmare returns when military forces lands near Nogovo.

Source: The Developer Website.

107564.name: Drumbeat: U-Boat II
107564.description:
Deadly Games' follow-on to their 1994 game U-Boat, takes the player to the shores of North America for what the U-Boat skippers called "The Happy Times".

From the manual:

DRUMBEAT is a campaign game recreating a series of U-boat patrols in the North Atlantic Ocean, The United States of America has just entered the war and Admiral Dönitz of the German Navy has his eye clearly focused on the rich opportunities awaiting him along its largely unprotected Eastern shores. This game can take you as far North as the Arctic Ocean and as far South as the Caribbean Sea. But you must stay alive to get there.

107565.name: U-Boat
107565.description:
Winner of Computer Game Review's Golden Triad Award.

From the user manual:

U-BOAT is a campaign game consisting of a series of sea patrols during the opening hostilities of WWII. Patrols begin in the Baltic Sea, extend into the North Sea and North Atlantic Ocean, and finally end somewhere in the Eastern reaches of the Mediterranean.

A patrol starts when you leave a U-boat base, and ends when you return to any U-boat base.

How long you spend at sea on an individual patrol is up to you. You are limited only by your nerve and fuel reserves, and may put into a U-boat base at any time.

107566.name: Midgard Bestiary: Volume 1 (AGE)
107566.description:
from the back of the PDF


Danger has 50 New Faces

Monsters are the pulsing heart of adventure—and also its claws and teeth! e Midgard
Bestiary for the AGE System o ers you more than 50 new foes to spring on characters in land
of lush forests, magic blasted wastes, and darkly dangerous cities:

• Visit the riverine hunting grounds of vicious Merrow, vengeful Lorelei, and
gruesome Eel Hounds. Dare to plumb the depths with Cave Dragons and Crag
Drakes in search of their great, glittering hordes, or send forth the oozing Sap
Demons, elemental Sparks, and Gilded Devils who roam in search of men’s souls.

• the Midgard Bestiary presents challenges for characters of all levels in AGE
System Set 1 or Set 2.

• Dozens of new monster stunts and powers!

Hope that spell and sword are enough to vanquish the foes presented within. Keep your
faith strong, your ears sharp, and your blade ready. Welcome, fool, to a catalogue of the most

107567.name: Sky Dancers
107567.description:
The object of Sky Dancers is to be the first Sky Dancer to return the stolen Sky Swirl Stone to Queen Skyla. Players first move through the Wingdom world, the Chaos Universe and finally to the High Hope Academy. To move from one world to another, your Dance Student pawn must change its form and turn into its Sky Dancer pawn.

Contents:

1 Game board platform
High Hope Academy
Chaos Universe
6 Sky Dancers pawns
6 Dance student pawns
1 Sky-Clone pawn
13 Plastic pawn stands
66 Game cards
Spinner

107568.description:
An expansion for Heroes of the Gap adding French forces from the mid-1980s.

Honneur et Patrie (Honor and Country) is the first expansion for Heroes of the Gap. The expansion introduces the French army into the third war to end all wars. Highlighting the fighting in not only West Germany, but also right into Paris, Honneur et Patrie features French conscripts, the Foreign Legion, Paratroopers, and lots of tanks. You’ll match AMX30 B-2 tanks against the best Russian armor, direct Jaguar airstrikes, and recon enemy positions with ERC-90 and AMX 10RC armored cars (tanks?).

The expansion includes 12, story-driven scenarios and plays out on the boards of the popular Heroes of the Blitzkrieg. With a plethora of new counters, new scenarios, and a unique perspective on some of the most beautiful boards ever drawn for the Lock ‘n Load system, what’s not to like?"

The expansion includes:

Approximately 130 counters representing the infantry, leaders, support weapons, vehicles, helicopters, and planes of the French fighting forces. Includes over 50 vehicles, helicopters, and planes. Nine extra die-cut Belgian counters (including a German, experimental E-100 tank and two scenarios will be included in any Purchaser level order below). These will only be available through our site.

12 story-driven scenarios.

Full color rules and scenario booklet.

All zipped up nice and neat in a durable zip-lock bag (Exception: limited edition is boxed, numbered and initialed. See below.).

You must own both Heroes of the Gap and Heroes of the Blitzkrieg to play Honneur et Patrie.

This game is no longer available and the new, improved and expanded edition can be found in Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes in Defiance
107568.name: Lock 'n Load: Honneur et Patrie
boardgameexpansion: Lock 'n Load: Heroes of the Blitzkrieg
Lock 'n Load: Heroes of the Gap

107569.name: Adventure Creation Handbook
107569.description:
From the Publisher's website:

You can learn to write good adventures and The Adventure Creation Handbook will show you how. Maybe you’re searching for an original idea. Or maybe you’ve just looking for a way to take that exciting climatic battle you see in your head and put it into a form your players will enjoy. Wherever you are in the adventure creation process, this book will guide you step-by-step through the process of creating an adventure for any genre, any game system.

107570.name: Ruritania: 1844
107570.description:
From the publisher's website

Ruritania: 1844 is a player's set of rules for serial live-action play.

Setting
Ruritania is set in a fictional country somewhere near southern Germany... Mostly. Readers may recognise a long list of inspirations, including Castle Falkenstein, H.P.Lovecraft, Girl Genius, Clive Barker (most especially Imajica), and much else besides.

System
Ruritania doesn't use dice, or cards, or any other randomiser. If you pay the time and other costs to employ an ability, it always works. This grants the game the kind of intense speed required for good live-action resolution; it may be altered in variant versions to provide more depth for tabletop or skirmish-style play.

107571.name: PT-109
107571.description:
PT-109 is a computer game developed by Digital Illusions and Spectrum HoloByte in 1987 for the MacIntosh and MS-DOS-compatible computers. This naval simulation game is roughly based on the events involving the Motor Torpedo Boat PT-109.

Source: Wikipedia, "PT-109 (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107572.description:
The only expansion for Palio.

Contains 10 new tiles, 34 stickers, 34 plastic miniatures, 2 "faster" dice than the base game and new rules.
107572.name: Palio Espansione

107573.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Battleship
107573.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

Battleship has three different modes from which to choose: Original, Salvo, and Super Weapons. Original plays just like everyone remembers. After the players place their ships (either manually or auto-placement), each player takes turns launching one "peg" to try and hit their opponent's hidden ship. Salvo is similar to Original, but now the players can shoot once for every one of their ships remaining in play. That means that each player gets five attempts if all five of their ships are still in play. Super Weapons is the most unique because every time a player misses, they get a chance to unlock a new weapon. These weapons consist of: reinforcements, lucky shot, heavy shot, decoy, and torpedo. Each has its own characteristics.

This game can be played either single-player vs AI, or local/network multi-player.

107574.name: X-15 Alpha Mission
107574.description:
User Summary

X-15 Alpha Mission is a flight simulator by Activision. The aim is to go out in space, from the ground, and destroy a space station that orbit the planet.

107575.name: 33 Miners Board Game
107575.description:
ABOUT THE GAME
Mining was their only livelihood. It was expected to be a normal working day when suddenly the upper galleries of the gold and copper mine collapsed, causing the miners to be trapped for months. In this rescue mission game, you and your team must try to overcome all odds in order to rescue these thirty three (33) trapped miners. To be successful, you and your team must meet all the government’s mandatory health, safety and environment (HSE) standards, acquire the necessary gears, and endeavor to avoid danger zones. Remember, the perils and rewards are high - just when you think you are about to enter the chamber to rescue a trapped miner, your mission might suffer a setback as the other rescue team progresses. This game is about individual effort, team work, risk, strategy and sacrifice.

NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 2 - 6.
AGES: 12yrs to adult.
PLAYING TIME: 45-60 minutes.

YOUR CHALLENGE
Your team’s objective is to rescue as many trapped miners as possible. This process is not without its challenges such as: the unavailability of cash to acquire the necessary gears, risky danger zones, overcoming fluctuating gear costs imposed by the Greedy Merchant and the ability to meet the mandatory standards imposed by the government through its agency The Bureau of Standards. Lives are at stake! The longer you wait, the more unlikely it will be that the trapped miners will survive. Can you rise to the challenge? Only time will tell.

GAME CONTENTS
The game box consists of game rules and instructions, 1 board, 1 dice, 33 tokens (depicting the trapped miners), 6 player pawns, 6 rescue gear kits (or placeholders for the players’ gears), 42 tokens (depicting the gears), 1 game price chart, 1 debtor sheet, 20 Bank Notes of $5, 30 Bank Notes of $10 and $20 respectively, 6 ‘holding card placeholders, and 2 decks of cards (HSE and Bureau of Standards). The deck of HSE cards are 35 in total and the deck of Bureau of Standards cards are 42 in total.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
107576.description:
The prehistoric players have already learned how to build huts and hunt food. Now they sit around the fire, gaze in wonder at the tribal matriarch, and wonder how they can look as good as her: "Why is my tooth just hanging?" "Honey, I also want something to make my skin look good."

In this expansion for Stone Age, style is the goal as ornaments and jewelry become part of the game – not to mention a merchant to handle such items. Players can now transform their raw materials into jewelry and other adornments.

This expansion includes a new location for the village, new cards, and new huts – not to mention components that allow game play with up to five Stone Age hunter-gatherers.
107576.name: Stone Age: The Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Boardcast News 4.3.2015 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 6 - Stone Age vs Tzolk'in The Mayan Calendar
LamasLive – Der Nachschlag!
The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Hans im Gluck

107577.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Scrabble
107577.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

There are three modes to this version of Scrabble. They are: Original (play with four players either locally or via the network), Tournament, and Bridge Builders (attempt to create words to link two sides of the board).


Note: During local multi-player, all players can see each others' selection of letters.


his game can be played either single-player vs AI, or local/network multi-player (with four players).

107578.name: Six Sizzlers
107578.description:
User Summary

Six Sizzlers was a compilation from Activision from 1987 containing six games.

107579.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Yahtzee
107579.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

Yatzee is presented with five different game modes: Original (plays just like everyone remembers), Advanced (includes wild dice that let you choose what number you want it to represent), Block Out (the first player to score a category "blocks" other players from using it), Half Card (where only the lower half of the scorecard is used), and Reverse (player with lowest score wins).

This game can be played either single-player vs AI, or local/network multi-player (up to four players).

107580.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Connect Four
107580.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

Connect Four has three game types from which to choose. They are: Original (traditional gameplay), Advanced (cascade chain reactions) and Power Chips (each player gets chips that have different powers such as 2x, Stop, and Force Down).

This game can be played either single-player vs AI, or local/network multi-player (two players).

107581.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Sorry
107581.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

Sorry has three game types: Original (traditional game play mechanics), Bonus Cards (adds unique cards to the deck - "Side Swipe" card that allows a player to send all the opposing pawns on one side of the board back home, "Wipeout" sends each player’s furthest pawn back to their starting point, and "Trade" which lets you steal one of someone else’s cards) or Custom.

This game can be played either single-player vs AI, or local/network multi-player (up to four players).

107582.name: Brain Toot
107582.description:
""Brain Toot" will give you a simple and fun way to help stimulate your brain with 16 brain training games to test your memory, mathematical, visual and thinking skills.

In just a few minutes, you can have a daily brain age exercise."

Source: The Developer Website.

107583.name: Ding!
107583.description:
From Publisher's Website:
Ding! is a fast-paced, trick-taking card game.
You don't need a partner, but you do need guts!

Race around the game board by taking tricks either one by one or by playing a Ding! a special move worth five tricks that propels you forward while sending your opponents backwards!

You start with 5 cards and can exchange up to 3 of them for new cards to try to spell Ding! or build a better trick-taking hand. However, you must take at least one trick a hand or you move backwards, further away from the Finish line.

You can opt out of any hand after all, the closer you are to winning, the more you have at stake.

107584.name: Brain Toot 2
107584.description:
"Brain Toot 2" will give you a simple and fun way to help stimulate your brain with 16 brain training games to test your memory, mathematical, visual and thinking skills.

In just a few minutes, you can have a daily brain age exercise.

A free version, called "Brain Toot Lite" is also available, which contains 4 brain training games.

Source: The Developer Website.

107585.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Sorry Sliders
107585.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

Sorry Sliders game includes three modes: Original (traditional shuffleboard game where you slide your pawns toward the center to knock others out and get yours Home), Advanced (rotating center increases difficulty and hole in the very center acts as an Instant Home portal), and Battle Boxes (power-ups appear on the board that can be triggered - Ghost, Guard, and Powershot).

107586.name: Hasbro Family Game Night: Boggle
107586.description:
User Summary

This is one of the games that can be accessed via the Hasbro Family Game Night client.

Boggle has three game modes: Original (the traditional game mode), Advanced (every time a word is completed, the first and last letters of the word transpose, and when 30 seconds are left in the match, the entire board mixes), and Word Hunt (players are given a set of words to try and find on the game board).

This game can be played either single-player vs AI, or local/network multi-player (up to four).

107587.name: Hidden Mysteries: Civil War
107587.description:
"Join General Alexander, loyal follower of Abe Lincoln, for a Civil War reenactment. Search original battlefields for clues and letters left by members of a secret society. These individuals hid millions of dollars in gold, cash, and coin. Scour 18 hidden object levels while advancing through time from the Battle of Fort Sumter (1861) to Lee’s surrender at Appotomattox (1865). Cross rivers and grassy knolls to unearth Hidden Mysteries of the Civil War."

Source: The Developer Website.

107588.name: Crazy Penguin Catapult
107588.description:
"Launch over 200 penguins in Campaign Mode or play endless matches in Strategy Mode.
Triumph in boss battles and unlock crazy penguin power-ups including Ninja, Fire, The Twins and more! Get an additional Strategy game that lets you command armies of penguins to attack and capture enemy polar bear territories. Didn’t get a perfect score? Retry levels to get the highest score possible with endless replay value! Watch your score bubble up as you are racing to break ice blocks and knock over polar bears."

Source: The Developer Website.

107590.name: Chicken Dance
107590.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Chicken Dance is a non-authorized version of Dancing Eggs. According to HABA, Top Toys does not have license to produce this game, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Dancing Eggs.




Chicken Dance has 16 eggs, and Dancing Eggs has 10, but the games are otherwise virtually identical.

From Dancing Eggs:
First a player rolls the red die. Depending on the result of the die roll, players can: attempt to be the first to take an egg from the box (or steal from someone else if there are none left in the box); drop an egg on the table and then compete to catch it; or even get up and run around the table to try to be the first back to their seat. When a player successfully wins an egg, he or she then rolls the white die, which indicates the location of the egg; between your cheek and your shoulder, your chin and the breast, between your knees, etc. When the first person drops an egg, the game ends and the one having the most points wins the game.

107591.name: Divinity II: The Dragon Knight Saga
107591.description:
Divinity II: The Dragon Knight Saga includes a remastered version of Divinity II: Ego Draconis, featuring new content and an improved engine, as well as the new Flames of Vengeance Add-On. Divinity II: The Dragon Knight Saga was released in the United States on the Xbox 360 on April 12, 2011 with a Soundtrack CD and art book.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Divinity_II:_Ego_Draconis," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107592.name: Stormtrooper
107592.description:
User Summary

Stormtrooper is a shoot'em-up game by Creation in 1988. You play as a soldier, and the game is horizontally scrolling, with platforms in three levels. On the way to the levels exits there is barriers blocking, they are deactivated by shooting terminals.

107593.name: Bazooka Blitzkrieg
107593.description:
Bazooka Blitzkrieg (Destructive in Japan) is a video game software released for the Super NES which makes use of the Super Scope light gun. It was released in 1992 by Bandai.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bazooka Blitzkrieg", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107594.name: Neo Geo Pocket Color
videogamehwversion: Camouflage Blue Neo Geo Pocket Color
Carbon Black Neo Geo Pocket Color
Crystal White Neo Geo Pocket Color
Platinum Blue Neo Geo Pocket Color
Platinum Silver Neo Geo Pocket Color
Stone Blue Neo Geo Pocket Color
107594.description:
The Neo Geo Pocket Color (shortened NGPC), is a 16-bit colour handheld game console by SNK. It was the last console they produced in the Neo Geo family. It was released on March 16, 1999 in Japan, August 6, 1999 in North America, and some time in 1999 in Europe.

The Neo Geo Pocket Color was designed to replace SNK's original Neo Geo Pocket monochrome handheld, which debuted in 1998 in Japan. In 2000, following SNK's purchase by Japanese pachinko manufacturer Aruze, the Neo Geo Pocket Color was dropped from both the North American and European markets. It did, however, last until 2001 in Japan, with a total of 2 million units sold.

Source: Wikipedia, "Neo Geo Pocket Color", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107595.name: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
107595.description:
JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is the commonly given name to any one of the versions and ports of a fighting game developed by Capcom based on the Japanese manga of the same title. The games were developed by the same team who are responsible for the Street Fighter III series.

Source: Wikipedia, "JoJo's Bizarre Adventure (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107596.description:
From the back of the box:

NOAH AND THE FLOOD, MOSES AND THE BURNING BUSH, THE EMPTY TOMB....Inspiring stories within the Bible. Now children and adults can learn about the Old and New Testament as they play the fun game of SEQUENCE. Pictures representing Bible stories are displayed on each card and the gameboard. The cards also include a story title and scripture reference. Players match the picture on a card to the same picture on the board, then place their chip there. Five chips in a row wins the game! It's the fun, challenging game of BIBLE SEQUENCE.
107596.name: Bible Sequence

107599.description:
From the manufacturer:

Get five gifts in a row to win – but watch out for the Grinch!

Ring in the holiday with a whole new take on the Dr. Seuss Christmas classic. Take a gift token from under the tree and see if you can find a match. But watch out – if you draw a Grinch tile, it’s anyone’s guess what will happen next! Drop the “Grinchy” coin down the chimney. The Grinch may steal your presents, or bring heart-warming holiday cheer. A whimsical Seussian twist on an all-time favorite game that’s fun for all ages!
107599.name: The Grinch Christmas Bingo Game

107601.name: Spread the Wealth Around
107601.description:
From the publisher:

The political boardgame, Spread the Wealth Around, exists to train you bitter clingers to practice the art of class warfare, dodge death panels, cheat on your taxes and do your small part to increase our national debt.

Choose membership in one of four organizations: Public Service, ObamaCare, Big Labor or Wall Street. From your perch atop the ruling class, you’ll bankrupt other players, drag them before show trials, carve them up in unnecessary surgery or just get one of your big labor goons to wack ‘em in Rocko Roulette.

Rather than accumulate wealth in Spread the Wealth Around, you’ll rack up mountains of debt just like Obama’s America. Scam dead people and collect their Social Security in Public Office. Unplug granny and play the lawsuit lottery in ObamaCare. Gamble and go burnin’ and lootin’ with Big Labor. Cut in line for your Wall Street bailout it’s all for the children.

Spread the Wealth Around is the perfect gift to cure that troglodyte Republican friend or conservative relation. No need for sensitivity training or coaching on tax and spend Obamanomics. Put away those teacher’s union pamphlets and Mao’s little red book. Play the political game that’s making the world safe for socialism!

107602.name: Octodad
videogamehonor: 2011 IGF Awards Student Showcase Winner
107602.description:
Octodad is a third person adventure game about destruction, deception, and fatherhood. The player controls Octodad, a dapper octopus masquerading as a human, as he goes about a day of his life. His existence is a constant struggle, as he must master mundane tasks with his unwieldy boneless tentacles while simultaneously keeping his cephalopodan nature a secret from his human family.

The player controls Octodad like a marionette, dragging his arms and legs around while his body flops along. The player’s goals are often simple household chores made difficult and interesting by the flailing, tenuous control they have over Octodad’s body. Being an octopus also has its strengths. Octodad can slip through tight spaces, grab objects with his suckers, and knock things around with tremendous strength. But if the player does things too out-of-the-ordinary, Octodad’s family will grow suspicious and realize what he really is. If they do, it’s game over for Octodad!

Source: The Game Website.

107604.name: Privacy No Limit
107604.description:
Privacy No Limit is the latest take on the Privacy game from designer Reinhard Staupe. As with earlier versions of the game, players are presented with a claim or question, secretly vote yes/no to the claim, then guess how many people they think will answer "yes" to the claim. If one or more players guess correctly, they score points; if no one was correct, then the players who are only one off score; if no one was one off, then the players who were two off score; and so on. The first player to score ten points wins.

As with Privacy: Scharf wie Chili, released in 2010 by AMIGO Spiel, Privacy No Limit features claims aimed an older audience, such as "I've farted while making love", "I've lied to my boss to get a co-worker in trouble" and "To survive, I would be willing to eat human flesh".

Privacy No Limit includes 420 questions and 12 envelopes that are placed into the voting box secretly so that no one will learn of your lying, farting cannibalistic tendencies.

107605.name: Paraguay
107605.description:
In 1864, South America was in critical condition, in the midst of a constitutional crisis in Uruguay, Brazil invaded Uruguay in support of Venancio Flores, in response, Paraguay invaded Brazil... It was the onset of major armed conflict in the history of the continent! From 1864 to 1870 nearly half a million people lost their lives in a conflict that placed war: Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay.

"Paraguay" is a board game for 2-4 players created by Julio Trois, whose theme is the War of Paraguay. For 10 rounds, the armies of Brazil, Argentina and Uruguay must defend their cities and destroy all the defenses of Paraguay. Aiming to conquest Asunción!

"Paraguay" is a tactical game, where military strategy is very important. Each player must organize his troops, composed of tiles of infantry, cavalry and artillery. The movement is point to point, and the clashes follow the style of the best wargames, using dices and tables, for the resolution of battles.

107606.name: Zombie Racers
107606.description:
User Summary

A top down driving game for the XBL Indie Marketplace. Run over the target number of zombies before time runs out. Pick up upgrades to help you kill more zombies.

The game sells for 80 MS Points.

107607.name: SpeedRunner HD
107607.description:
User Summary

Complete short levels as quickly as you can. Preform special walljump, double jump moves, and use items like a grappling hook to advance past obstacles. Use weapons like homing missiles, and remote bombs. Replay earlier levels with unlocked gadgets to improve your finish times. The game supports multiplayer for up to four players.

107609.name: Campagnes: Héritage
107609.description:
'Introduction
À terme, cette campagne devrait être constituée de cinq ou six scénarios et amènera les personnages des joueurs à parcourir les deux galaxies et à en côtoyer les principaux acteurs afin de mener à bien leur mission. Leurs pérégrinations leur permettront de découvrir de nombreux lieux majeurs de Miwéa et Koméa et ainsi donneront aux joueurs une bonne vision d'ensemble de l'univers de jeu. Cette campagne est également développée dans l'optique d'être suffisamment généraliste pour pouvoir être facilement adaptée à d'autres contextes typés Space Opera.

Google Translation
Ultimately, this campaign should consist of five or six scenarios and bring the characters of the players to go both galaxies and to mix with the main actors to carry out their mission. Their travels will allow them to discover many places and major Miwéa Koméa and thus give players a good overview of the universe of play The campaign is also being developed with the aim to be general enough to be easily adapted to other contexts typed Space Opera.

107610.name: BeamWars
107610.description:
BeamWars is a Macintosh shareware arcade-style game that was popular in the early 1990s, created by Steve Crutchfield while he was attending the Illinois Math and Science Academy. Its pioneering use of digitized sound, music and voice effects (including the trademark "Welcome to BeamWars" and "The game is a draw" samples), and arrival as one of the first well-known full-color games for the Macintosh, won it a number of accolades, including recognition as one of the three best Macintosh shareware games of all time in MacUser magazine's 1992 book, "MacUser's Guide to Shareware".

The player controls a beam of light which is capable of moving up, down, left or right. The objective is to avoid hitting anything while forcing your opponents' beams to crash into yours, their own, or a wall. After a set amount of time, the walls begin to close in, making survival more difficult and forcing players closer together. The winner of each round is the last surviving beam, and points are awarded based on how long each beam survived. After a few rounds, the player with the highest score wins the game. The game supports a maximum of 4 players, either human or computer controlled.

Source: Wikipedia, "BeamWars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

107611.name: Words of Wisdom: The Game
107611.description:
In Words of Wisdom: the Game 2-10 players compete against one another to be the first to get rid of all the cards in their hands. Each player begins with 7 cards from one of the 2 decks and must attempt to play his cards to a community board. The board is divided into 2 sections, and players must play cards only to their designated spaces on the board, only when adjacent to other placed cards, and only into 1 section per turn. Players may choose to (or may occasionally be forced to) draw simultaneously from both the Book Deck (which has more of the same cards that were dealt initially) and the Providence Deck (which enables special placements). Some cards are setbacks when drawn, while others allow opponents to save each other from the setbacks (and benefit themselves in the process.)

The game can be played in either of 2 ways. The Standard Version contains a few extra cards which force play to the board and which create blockages on the board that can be removed only through cooperative effort. This extra layer of complexity provides opportunity for cooperative play and additional strategy which is not available in the much simpler Family Version of the game (which is better suited for children and casual gamers.) In addition to removing a few cards from the decks, the Family Version allows for a different ending to the game: where the Standard Version is resolved in a Discard Phase that awards victory to the lowest scorer, the Family Version is won simply when any player goes out, having played all their cards on their turn.

Words of Wisdom: the Game has an overtly Biblical theme. The numbered board spaces represent the 66 books of the Bible, and the cards in the Book Deck represent individual books of the Bible. The cards in the Providence Deck channel Bible-based occurrences such as Trials, Miracles, Prophecies, and Parables. Nevertheless, the theme is as light and non-intrusive as the game play is: the rules state that no familiarity with the Bible is necessary to play, enjoy, or win the game. Likewise, there are no specific teachings or stories told through the game itself. If the game attempts anything spiritual, it is only to familiarize the players with the names and order of the books that make up the Bible.

107612.name: The Doko Demo Kanji Quiz
107612.description:
User Summary

10th game is the Simple DS series, The Doko Demo Kanji Quiz is an edutainment game developed by Vingt-et-un Systems and published by D3, using quizes and other puzzles to teach the different meanings and expressions of Japanese kanji characters.

107613.name: Super Speed Machines
107613.description:
User Summary

Super Speed Machines is the 13th game in the Simple DS series. A top-town racer, players race on the top screen and use the map displayed on the bottom screen to find shortcuts and avoid hazards which each player places on the track before the race starts.

107614.name: The Soukou Kihei Gun Ground
107614.description:
User Summary

The Souhou Kihei Gun Ground is a side-scrolling mech action game, and the 18th game in the Simple DS series. In between levels, money earned in levels can be spend to upgrade the player's mech.

107617.name: The Mahjong
107617.description:
User Summary

The very first in the Simple DS series, a Japanese series of budget games, The Mahjong offers the classic tile game for DS.

107618.name: Billard Action
107618.description:
User Summary

Billards Action is standard billards gameplay for the DS, with unlockable CPU difficulty levels and surfaces. In Japan, this game is the second installment in the Simple DS series.

107619.name: Les Écrans Deflecteurs & Les Champs de Force
107619.description:
Introduction
Les Ecrans Déflecteurs sont de puissantes barrières d’énergie généralement sphériques créées par des générateurs d’écrans, qui entourent le véhicule qu’ils protègent et qui permettent de neutraliser les projectiles orbitaux, les micro-astéroïdes et dans une moindre mesure les rayons énergétiques provenant de
tirs d’armes lourdes. Les écrans, quelle que soit la taille du véhicule qu’ils protègent, sont considérés comme appartenant à la catégorie 1 : la catégorie des personnages. Les Champs de Force à Particules constituent la version portative et miniaturisée des écrans, ils disposent de leur propre alimentation en énergie (généralement une batterie).

Google Translation
The deflector screen are powerful, generally spherical energy barriers created by generators of screens surrounding the vehicle they protect. They help neutralize orbital shots, micro-asteroids and, to a lesser extent, energy rays from heavy weapons. Screens, regardless of the size of the vehicle they protect, are considered as belonging to a category: the category of characters. Force fields Particulate are portable and miniaturized version of screens, they have their own supply
energy (usually a battery).

107620.name: Liste des Ecrans
107620.description:
Introduction
This is a table for deflectors and force fields for use in the Twin Galaxies RPG.

107621.name: Liste des Explosifs
107621.description:
Introduction
This is a table for explosives and heavy weaponry for use in the Twin Galaxies RPG.

107622.name: Les Explosifs & Les Projectiles Explosifs
107622.description:
Introduction
This is a document regarding the use and effectiveness of explosives and explosive projectiles in the world of Twin Galaxies. It includes tables for damage, range, launchers, and so on.

107623.name: Reparations & Entretien
107623.description:
Introduction
A la suite de dégâts ou à la suite d’une panne, un véhicule, un vaisseau ou un équipement peut nécessiter d’être réparé afin de fonctionner de nouveau, s’il n’a pas été rendu totalement inutilisable par les dégâts ou la panne qu’il a subit. S’il est parfois difficile d’éviter d’essuyer des dommages préjudiciables au bon fonctionnement d’un équipement ou d’un véhicule, il est par contre possible d’éviter les pannes en effectuant régulièrement un entretien ou une maintenance ainsi que des vérifications de contrôle c’est pourquoi il est particulièrement important d’effectuer régulièrement des révisons permettant de s’assurer que tout fonctionne correctement ou de détecter d’éventuels signes avant-coureurs annonçant de futurs dysfonctionnements.

Google Translation
As a result of damage or as a result of a breakdown, a vehicle, vessel or equipment may need to be repaired to run again, if not rendered completely unusable by the damage or breakdown he suffered. It is sometimes difficult to avoid wiping damage detrimental to the proper functioning of equipment or vehicle, it is possible to prevent against failures by performing regular maintenance or a maintenance and audits control so it is especially important to conduct regular revise to ensure that everything is working properly or to detect possible warning signs announcing future malfunctions.

107624.name: Headshot Z
107624.description:
User Summary

Play as a soldier trying to stop a zombie apocalypse. Look through the site of your sniper rifles to try to find the zombies in a large group of people. Get bonuses for each civilian that survives.

107625.name: Headshot God
107625.description:
User Summary

Play as God as you attempt to drop lightning bolts on your targets. Learn your targets pattern and try to strike them while limiting civilian casualties for bonus points.

107626.name: Headshot 2
107626.description:
User Summary

You are a hitman who must quickly find your target in a large crowd of people. Once given the photo of your target find and shoot them as fast as you can to get the most points.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace for 80 MS Points.

107627.name: Headshot
107627.description:
User Summary

You are a sniper watching over a crowd of people, after a certain amount of time someone will pull out a gun and try to shoot someone, it is your job to kill the assassin before he fires. The game gets faster the longer it goes on.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace for 80 MS Points.

107628.name: Raid (2010)
107628.description:
User Summary

Take control of three swat officers as you attempt to cleat buildings from enemies. Press the button shown under a target after breaching a room to shoot the target before they can fire. As the game goes on unlock a sniper to aid you and avoid shooting unharmed civilians mixed with your enemies.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace for 80 MS Points.

107629.name: Shoot or Date
107629.description:
User Summary

The game shows you if you want to date men or women and then shows you pictures. Press X to shoot the people with gun, B to date the people of the gender the game tells you, or do nothing to leave the unharmed people of the opposite gender alone. Earn points until your reputation reaches 0, gain reputation for choosing the correct action. The speed will increase as the game goes on.

The game is available for 80 MS Points on the XBL Indie Marketplace.

107630.name: Galactic Crusader
107630.description:
User Summary

Galactic Crusader is a space shooter similar to Galaga in which you control a bug-like spaceship and must over come wave after wave of oncoming enemies. Your ship is equipped with lasers and missiles. Furthermore, occasional power-ups you collect from destroyed enemies can increase your firing ability. Defeating a powerful enemy boss at the end of every stage allows to proceed to the next stage.

107631.name: Scénarios: Desseins Machiavéliques
107631.description:
Introduction
Cette aventure, axée au départ sur la diplomatie, tourne assez rapidement à l’enquête après qu’un meurtre ait été commis dans le palais où ont lieu les négociations. Ce scénario indépendant est prévu pour un nouveau groupe de personnages mais peut facilement être adapté pour utiliser des personnages existants. Étant relativement complexe, il convient plus particulièrement à des joueurs assez expérimentés et pour lesquels l’usage de la dialectique est relativement aisé.

Google Translation
This adventure, originally focused on diplomacy, turning quickly to the inquiry after a murder was committed in the palace where the negotiations take place. This scenario is designed for independent new group of characters, but can easily be adapted to use existing characters. Is relatively complex, it is particularly suitable for very experienced players and for which use of the dialectic is relatively easy.

107632.name: Ranger
107632.description:
User Summary

You are the greatest elven ranger and must protect your people. Use your bow to shoot enemies, powerups, and four different spells that you can charge your arrows with for different effects. Combine magic with special attacks to find new combinations. Summon a dragon to help you kill the enemies on screen and to heal. If enemies get passed you you lose health, lose of your health and it is game over.

The game is available for 80 MS Points on the XBL Indie Marketplace.

107633.name: Murder in Elmshire
107633.description:
From the frontpage of the module:

An embattled plea from a halfling village leads to dark secrets. What has happened to the poor citizens of this quiet community along the Lake of Unkown Depths? A one-round Core adventure set in the Domain of Greyhawk for characters level 1 - 11 (APLs 2 - 8).

107634.name: Return to the Storm Tower
107634.description:
From the Front Page of the Module:

Five years ago, a dwarven artisan and a cleric of Fharlanghn were stranded on the shores of the Pomarj. These two unfortunates have been presumed dead for years. New information has revealed they are alive in a mysterious keep called the Storm Tower and may be in great danger. Brave heroes are needed to venture into the Pomarj and bring them home. A one-round Core adventure set in the Pomarj for characters level 1 - 15 (APLs 2 - 12).

107635.description:
In the bustling market of Cairo, traders build their stalls and try to entice customers with attractive goods, with each customer bringing money that the trader can then use to expand that stall or establish new stalls.

To set up Kairo, players first take turns placing three colored stalls (out of six) on the game board. They also take three stall cards (which highlight one or more sections on the game board) and one coin of each of the six colors. Five colored customers start at particular locations on the game board, with the sixth customer placed to the side. On a turn, a player either:


Draws two cards (face-up or face-down stall cards or market barker cards).
Moves a customer to a stall of that customer's color.
Plays a stall card; then builds a new stall, expands an existing stall, or moves a blocked-off stall.


The active player can choose to move any customer, and that customer will move to the closest stall (measured on orthogonal paths) of the same color. Additionally, this player can choose to play one or more market barker cards to "call" the customer past one or more stalls, presumably to bring the customer to that player's own stall. If the active player owns the visited stall, he receives one coin of the stall's color for each tile in that stall; if not, the active player receives a one coin commission while the owner receives the normal payout. This customer is then swapped with the customer off the board.

When building a new stall, a player cannot place it in the same region as another stall of the same color. Regulations! Restaurants must be placed in an area designated for them, while all other stalls must go in the market area. When expanding an existing stall, the player must pay one coin of the same color for each tile in the enlarged stall. By expanding, you can earn more coins when customers visit, create longer paths to opponents' stalls, reserve area in which to expand further, and (most importantly) earn victory points. You score VPs each time you expand, and if your stall is the largest (or tied for the largest) of that color, you'll take one or two medals that provide a VP bonus.

Once the expansions run low in one or two colors, players can only build or expand. Once everyone has finished building, the game ends, with players earning VPs for the medals and money they have in hand. The player with the most points wins.
107635.name: Kairo

107636.name: Phantom Thief Jewel
107636.description:
User summary:

A quick "outguess the others" card game for 3–5 players.
On the game table there are five rows, labeled A to E, of treasure cards with numbers 2, 3, 4, 7 or –4. Each round, one treasure card is added to each row, and players secretly choose one of the rows and reveal their choices simultaneously. If two or more players choose the same row, they get nothing and the row is untouched. Players who are alone in their choice get all the treasure cards in that row. No player can choose the same row two rounds in a row.

Game lasts for 12 rounds, and at the end of the game, having three cards of the same value earns the player that many points. The player with the most points at the end wins.

Translated box back
You are thieves specializing in jewelry, and each night, you announce in beforehand which shop you are aiming at. But beware, only one thief can enter each shop per night. If another thief has chosen the same place, your pride won't allow you to share. And while others thieves are staring at each other, you have your chance next night… but don't forget that that's what everybody else thinks, too…!

107638.description:
A merchant's job doesn't consist of simply sitting around and earning money. Sometimes they need to sell their shirt to call for help from others. Sometimes they need to banter and fight for prices. And sometimes they have to swallow their tears and abandon all they have built. If you can overcome these hurdles, earn the trust of people and build up a fortune, then you will be a true master merchant.

Master Merchant is a "hand-building" card game along the lines of the "deck-building" genre started by Dominion, except that players have no deck – only a hand of cards and a discard pile.

Players start with a hand of two cards: "Steal one gold from all players with four or more gold" and "Buy a card from the town". On each turn a player can play up to two cards from his hand, either face up to gain a card's effect or face down to gain one gold.

The "town" consists of ten different types of cards, which cost 1-4 gold. All cards played and purchased go into a player's personal discard pile, which is open information to all players. If a player starts his turn with no cards, he picks up his entire discard pile. The first player to get eight gold or eight different cards wins the game.

This game's setting is same as Mai-Star, which is from the same designer, artist and publisher.
boardgameversion: English/Japanese first edition (Comic Market 2011, no box)

107639.name: Job hunting
107639.description:
User summary

A set collecting card game with special effects. The card deck consists of cards of varying colour and titles. Players start with a small hand of cards and some cards laid face up on the table. On a player's turn, he may either use one card from hand to grab one of the face up cards, or if he can't, play a card into the open area. Some cards have a special effect when gained.

The goal of the game is to get a set of same coloured, but differently titled cards, representing a deep knowledge in a specific area important for job-searching.

Translated box back
This is a simple game in which the players collect skill cards in order to get a job offer. Three skill cards of the same colour earns you one job offer! But beware, because among the skill cards, there are some that force you to draw an event card, and who knows what may happen then. The first player to get a set number of job offers wins!

107640.description:
User summary
A cooperative card game based on the Japanese animated TV show "Puella Magi Madoka Magica", implementing the mechanism from Hanabi. From a deck of cards, players draw a set number of cards but may not look at them. Instead, the cards are held so that all other players see them. On a turn, a player may either play a card from his hand, or say something about another player's cards. Revealing information increases the soul gem contamination level, and this can only be cleansed by drawing witch cards. If the contamination reaches level 3, the game is over, the world is destroyed, and the players have lost. Witch cards can be returned to the witch deck by discarding cards from hand, but once the normal card deck runs out, the game ends.

The goal of the game is to get cards in the right order onto the table, so that all five magical girls: Madoka, Homura, Mami, Kyoko and Sayaka are fully transformed. For extra advanced play, players can choose to add the Incubator to the fray.

Website genre blurb
A cooperative card game for up to 4 players, "Hanabi" type.

Re-implements:

Hanabi
107640.name: MadoMagion

107641.name: Unfair Quest
107641.description:
User summary
A semi-cooperative bluffing board game. Players each take the role of an adventure party member and help out defeating monsters. Once the game ends, each player puts forward the treasures that he has earned, however everyone is allowed to stash away anything he suspects the other players didn't notice him getting. Players can then accuse each other for not being honest, and anyone caught in the act has to pay a penalty. The player with the most treasures at the end wins.

Translated box back
Players cooperate to form a party and defeat the monster in the Lost Forest. When all is done, the gems that players have earned are all divided. But that's not wholly true. You are allowed to hide away the gems you believe your party members don't remember you getting. If you get away with it, you can keep it for yourself. And the player who have earned the most money wins.

107642.name: Take Arms
107642.description:
User Summary

A multiplayer game for the Indie Arcade that supports up to eight players. Choose from three different characters to play as with different weapons sniper rifle, burst fire rifle, and LMG. Play games of deathmatch, team deathmatch, and capture the flag.

The game also supports single player games against bots.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Arcade for 240 MS Points.

107643.name: Soul
107643.description:
User Summary

Attempt to lead a dead mans soul to heaven. Avoid dark creatures and avoid running into any obstacles to escape each area.

Soul is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace for 80 MS Points.

107644.name: Shoot 1UP
107644.description:
User Summary

A vertical shoot em up game. Unlike a traditional game where you pilot only one ship or earn more with bonuses this game has you commanding three ships at once. You can have the ships fly closer or further apart and when they are all firing they can combine their power for a more powerful shot.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace for 80 MS Points.

107645.name: Trailer Park King
107645.description:
User Summary

You are a man named King living in a trailer park. After a date goes wrong you return to your trailer to find a dead man on your floor and are soon arrested. It is your job to find out what happened. The game plays like a point and click adventure with you being able to walk into new rooms and areas to explore.

The game is available on the XBL Indie Marketplace for 80 MS Points.
